poem:
Title: "Morning News, Unsung Lament"

In the marketplace of power, voices rise,
over sweet tea and bitter truths.
War's children, clad in stubborn pride,
negotiate freedom in the stale air of hellos and goodbyes.
Look hard enough, amid the cries,
you will witness an offering of peace, a darted olive branch,
hidden within frayed sentences,
a testament to the unfinished symphony of our human frailty.
